document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Jucancistrocerus Blüthgen, 1938 from China, with review of three related genera (Hymenoptera: Vespidae: Eumeninae)

treatmentCitationGroup.paragraph:
Odynerus ornatus André, 1884: 713
[junior secondary homonym of
Ancistrocerus ornatus Smith, 1852
, and
Leptochilus ornatus de Saussure, 1853
, both placed by Dalla Torre in
Odynerus
];
Kostylev, 1940: 41
( tashkensis [!]).

Odynerus tachkensis Dalla Torre, 1889: 125
. Replacement name.

Jucancistrocerus tachkensis : Giordani Soika, 1970: 106
, figs. 38, 39;
van der Vecht and Fischer, 1972: 64
.
Li, 1985: 124
, fig. VI-4 (misidentification); Gusenleitner, 2013: 40 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 32–40.
Jucancistrocerus ( Jucancistrocerus ) angustifrons
, 32, 34, 36–38, ♀ ; 33, 35, 39–40, ♂ . 32–33. Habitus, dorsal view; 34–35. Head, frontal view; 36. Propodeum, dorsal view; 37. Metasoma, dorsal view; 38. Metasoma, ventral view; 39. Antenna; 40. Genitalia, lateral view.

FIGURES 41–46. (taken by Alexander V. Fateryga).
Jucancistrocerus ( Jucancistrocerus ) angustifrons
, paralectotypes, 41, 43, 45, ♀; 42, 44, 46, ♂. 41–42. Habitus, dorsal view; 43–44. Habitus, lateral view; 45–46. Head, frontal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes . According to references and specimens, it is verified that
J. ( J. ) tachkensis ( Dalla Torre, 1889 )
(Fig VI-4, in Li 1985 ) was misidentified, and Li’s (1985) specimens actually belong to
Pararrhynchium ornatum multifasciatum Giordani Soika, 1986
. To date,
J. ( J. ) tachkensis
is distributed in Xinjiang rather than Jiangsu , Zhejiang or Sichuan of China .
